content:
Sónar是一个艺术、设计以及电子和实验音乐节，由Ricard Robles、Enric Palau和Sergi Caballero于1994年在巴塞罗那创立。 该音乐节自成立以来一直被分为两个部分。 Sónar by Day和Sónar by Night，自2013年以来，还有一个为期三天的大会，专门讨论创意、技术和商业。 除了巴塞罗那的旗舰活动，Sónar还在世界各地举办活动，目前在波哥大、布宜诺斯艾利斯、香港、雷克雅未克和伊斯坦布尔举办年度音乐节。

 

曾在Sónar演出的艺术家包括Björk, Thom Yorke, Jean-Michel Jarre, Duran Duran, Grace Jones, Beastie Boys, De La Soul, Kraftwerk, Gorillaz, New Order, Skrillex, Diplo, M.I.A., Arca, Rosalía, Chic, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Aphex Twin, Richie Hawtin 和Laurent Garnier.

 

《纽约时报》在2017年写道："Sónar已经把自己建成了一个欧洲机构......这是一个实验性的音乐节。 这是一个实验性和群众喜闻乐见的音乐节，微妙的和不微妙的，从安静的小观众席表演到地震狂热般的stadium舞曲...."

 

诞生和早期（1994-1996）

Sónar于1994年在巴塞罗那成立，名为 "高级音乐和多媒体艺术节"，由音乐记者Ricard Robles和音乐家及视觉艺术家Enric Palau和Sergio Caballero创办。 第一届音乐节于6月2日、3日和4日在巴塞罗那当代文化中心（Sónar by Day）和Apolo俱乐部（Sónar by Night）举行，Holger Czukay、Mixmaster Morris、Laurent Garnier、Sven Väth、Atom Heart和Trans Global Underground等人进行了演出。 这第一次活动，包括唱片展和技术展--现在称为Sonar+D的前身--有近6000人和40名西班牙媒体代表参加。

 

在接下来的两年里，音乐节的规模大幅扩大：持证人数在1995年翻了一番，1996年翻了三番，游客人数从6000人增加到1995年的12000多人，1996年的18000人。 Sónar by Night在其第二年进行了搬迁，搬到了Poble Espanyol的各个区域，1995年和1996年都在这里举行。 这些年的一些演出和会议包括Coldcut、Spring Heel Jack、Josh Wink、Autechre、Richie Hawtin、Ken Ishii、Slam、Jeff Mills、Scanner、Orbital、Fangoria、John Acquaviva、Kenny Larkin和Biosphere。

 

演变和成长（1997-2000）

1997年是音乐节的一个转折点，因为Sónar by Night搬到了一个新的场地，Mar Bella运动馆，使其容量增加了两倍。 随着90年代末的到来，人数出现了可观的增长：从1996年的18000名游客到1997年的28000名，1998年的38000名，1999年的43000名和2000年的53000名以上。 艺术节的发展也可以用被认可的媒体数量来衡量：1996年有72家西班牙媒体和15家国际媒体，到2000年，这个数字分别上升到158和185。

 

这四年中在Sónar by Day演出的艺术家包括Squarepusher、Fennesz、Bruce Gilbert、Patrick Pulsinger、Pan Sonic、Mouse On Mars、Suicide、Aviador Dro、DJ Spooky、Pole、DJ Zero、Goldfrapp，以及Merzbow、Daft Punk、Kraftwerk、Kruder & Dorfmeister、Jimi Tenor。 Laurent Garnier（以他的真名或化名DJ Jamon）、Marc Almond、Deep Dish、Motorbass、Plastikman、Herbert、Death In Vegas、Fila Brazillia、Roger Sánchez、Coldcut、DJ Hell、Sólo Los Solo、Atari Teenage Riot、An Der Beat、Chicks On Speed、Super Collider和Miss Kittin。

 

二十一世纪的Sónar（2000年至今）

在二十一世纪的最初几年，Sónar继续增长，先是稳定在每年8万名左右的观众，然后在2013年的20周年庆典上进一步增长到121000人。 这一出席记录在2017年（123,00人）和2018年的25周年庆典上（126,000人）再次被打破。 在这一时期，由于其前瞻性的节目编排和制作，Sónar继续对评论家和艺术家产生了影响。 正如《金融时报》在2006年的评论中所报道的："[The Scissor Sisters' Jake Shears]并不是唯一一个将Sónar音乐节作为对其职业生涯产生根本影响的艺术家"。

 

2001年的音乐节，Sónar by Night的场地又有了变化，变成了L'Hospitalet de Llobregat的Fira Gran Via地区的大型场地。 这个新家意味着可以提供具有强烈视听效果的大型音乐会，吸引了许多艺术家的表演，如bjork（2002年）、Kraftwerk（2013年有3D表演）和The Chemical Brothers（2005年和2015年）。

 

Sónar by Night场地有几个舞台；可容纳15000人的SonarClub、露天的SonarLab和SonarPub以及SonarCar。 在2016年，这个舞台得到了升级，具有一个定制的音响系统和一个新的格式，由选定的DJ连续7小时的演出。 首届节日的主角是Laurent Garnier（他协助了该形式的发展）和Four Tet。

 

Sónar by Day也巩固了其广泛的范围，它不仅基于音乐，还包括SonarMàtica的展览、SonarPro的活动、SonarCinema的放映和Sonarama的装置。 在这些年里，音乐节还与各种机构、空间和中心合作，如GREC音乐节、圣莫尼卡艺术中心、密斯-凡-德-罗基金会、CosmoCaixa和L'Auditori（巴塞罗那交响乐团和加泰罗尼亚国家乐团与坂本龙一+泛音+Fennesz、Francesco Tristano+Murcof、Matthew Herbert大乐队和DJ /rupture等人的音乐会的举办地。

 

2013年，Sónar by Day搬出了它以前在MACBA的家，搬到了位于Plaza d'Espanya的Fira Montjuïc设施中的一个更大的空间。 Sónar by Day的音乐节目在五个舞台上进行。 SonarHall、SonarDome（由红牛音乐提供）、SonarComplex礼堂、SonarXS（致力于来自全球街道的城市声音）以及由Estrella Damm提供的户外舞台SonarVillage，其标志性的人工草地。 2018年，Sonar增加了一个额外的舞台Sonar360º by Mediapro，专门用于全穹顶体验。

 

在此期间演出的知名艺术家包括M.I.A.、De La Soul、Linton Kwesi Johnson、The Roots、Justice、Hot Chip、Janelle Monáe、Leila、Madlib、Prefuse 73、Ricardo Villalobos、Kode9、Plaid、The Sugarhill Gang和Flying Lotus。 Björk（2002年）、Beastie Boys（2007年）、LCD Soundsystem（2010年）、Chic（2006年）、Pet Shop Boys（2002年）、Masters At Work（2001年）、Grace Jones（2009年），以及The Chemical Brothers（2005年和2015年）、Kraftwerk、Jurassic 5。 Richie Hawtin, Skrillex, Paul Kalkbrenner, Major Lazer, Jamie Lidell, Diamond Version, Chromatics, Diplo, Baauer, Nicolas Jaar, Liars, Lindstrøm & Todd Terje, Adrian Sherwood & Pinch, Seth Troxler, Gold Panda. Autechre, FKA Twigs, A$AP Rocky Jean-Michel Jarre, New Order, and Anhoni

 

2019年，Sónar将其巴塞罗那版的日期从6月转移到7月，并增加了对Latin, urban, trap 和reggaeton音乐类型的行为的关注 。

 

Sónar和巴塞罗那

2004年，Sónar为加泰罗尼亚的GDP贡献了4700万欧元（根据德勤公司的研究）。2015年，Sónar委托进行的后续360度研究将这一数字更新为1.26亿欧元；十年间增长了226%，对城市的净价值为每个参会者559.7欧元。

 

对该市的酒店入住率的影响也是相当大的。 2011年的入住率为83.65%，2012年为83.11%。 对于官方批准的旅游公寓，这些数字增加到100%。

 

除了上述情况，Sónar还导致了节日本身范围之外在巴塞罗那举行的其他活动、演讲和展示的扩散和组织，这反过来也吸引了非常多的观众，除了参加官方活动的12.6万名游客之外，还有5到7万名游客。

 

世界各地的Sónar

自2002年首次在伦敦举办国际活动以来，Sónar已在全球范围内扩展其影响力，在全球4大洲65个城市举办了同名活动。所有的Sónar活动都反映了一个更广泛的使命，即在每个地区的当地和国际场景之间创造一种对话，并具有强大的创意技术成分。

 

到目前为止，这些地点包括芝加哥、布宜诺斯艾利斯、圣保罗、汉堡、波哥大、纽约、首尔、罗马、开普敦、哥本哈根、东京和香港。近年来，Sónar+D还扩大了其国际项目，在圣保罗（2015年）智利圣地亚哥（2015年）、布宜诺斯艾利斯（2015年）、雷克雅未克（2015年）、波哥大（2015、2016、2017、2018年）、香港（2017年）和伊斯坦布尔（2017年）构成了项目的一部分。

 

截至2018年，Sónar每年在6个城市举办活动，每年的总人数为30,000人。

 

Sónar Reykjavik

Sónar Reykjavik在HARPA音乐厅的四个舞台上进行。著名的演出者包括Skrillex、Underworld、Danny Brown、Fatboy Slim、Gus Gus、Kiasmos和Paul Kalkbrenner。

 

"对于任何想要将一些令人惊叹的自然美景的体验与世界领先的电子音乐节目结合起来的人来说，这是一个必须的选择" 。

 

这个音乐节是 "关于音乐如何到达那些真正寻求它的人的一次实验"。

 

伊斯坦布尔Sónar音乐节

首届伊斯坦布尔Sónar音乐节于2017年在ZorluPSM礼堂举行。到目前为止，该音乐节的表演者包括：Nina Kraviz、Black Coffee、Fatboy Slim和Jon Hopkins。

 

Sónar香港

2017年，Sónar在其国际音乐节中加入了香港。该活动在香港科学园举行，有DJ Shadow、Laurent Garnier、The Black Madonna和Squarepusher等人的表演。

 

"总共有40多个国际、地区和本地的DJ和现场表演--包括11个首次在香港亮相的表演--Sónar再一次证实了它作为世界上最好的电子音乐节的称号 。

 

Sónar Bogota和Sónar Buenos Aires

Sónar在拉丁美洲的活动每年11月下旬举行，地点是Multiparque（Sónar Bogotá）和Technopolis Argentina（Sónar Buenos Aires）。著名的表演艺术家包括Sigur Rós、Nina Kraviz、Dubfire、Pantha du Prince、Moderat等。

 

Sónar是We are Europe Edit的一部分

自2015年12月起，Sónar成为We are Europe的一部分，这是一个由欧盟Creative Europe计划共同发起的合作项目，由法国组织Arty Farty（Nuits sonores Festival）领导，聚集了8个主要的欧洲活动，联手促进、创造和生产创新的文化实践，以创意多样性和交流为定义。

 

Sónar +D 

在1994年的首届展会上，Sónar为专业人士组织了一个具有双重性的展会：一个唱片和出版展会（唱片公司、经销商、出版物、出版商、推广者）和一个技术展会（硬件和软件品牌、音乐设备公司）。多年来，这种形式经历了几次蜕变，逐渐脱离了贸易展的形式，扩大到包括艺术装置、电影放映、讲座和会议。2013年，随着Sónar by Day移至Fira Montjuic，音乐节的这一部分项目被重新设计为Sónar+D。

 

作为一个为期3天的创意、技术和商业大会，与Sónar by Day同时进行，（SonaR+D = Sónar+D）。大会包括装置、讲座、展览和具有创意应用的新技术展示。自2017年起，计划中增加了一个交流日。该活动在艺术节开始前一天开始，以B2B活动为导向，仅对代表证持有人开放。

 

在为期3天的Sónar by Day期间，Sónar+D的80%的活动都对普通观众开放，鼓励艺术家、创客和对创意充满好奇的人之间进行交流。

 

Sónar +D也从更广泛的艺术节项目中得到反馈，在艺术节的所有舞台上都有技术展示，并邀请著名艺术家进行讲座和研讨会。最近几届的艺术家和思想家包括 Brian Eno, Björk, Jean-Michel Jarre, Richie Hawtin, Kode 9, Holly Herndon, Alva Noto 和Ryuichi Sakamoto。

 

截至2018年，积极参与Sónar+D的公司和机构包括BBC R+D、Spotify、谷歌文化艺术、环球音乐集团、索尼音乐、PS4、惠普、Me by Melia、Mediapro、Native Instruments、MIT Media Lab, Roland Instruments 和Pioneer DJ等。

 

Sónar+D Hong Kong与每年在香港科学园举行的Sónar Hong Kong活动同时进行。

 

Sónar Calling GJ273b 

为了纪念2018年Sónar的25周年，音乐节开始了一项实验，将33首音乐送到Luyten b，一颗可能适合居住的外星球，距离地球12.4光年。与音乐节关系密切的艺术家提交了特别创作的音乐作品，包括Jean-Michel Jarre, Autechre, Squarepusher, Nina Kraviz, The Black Madonna, Matmos, Laurent Garnier 和Olafur Arnalds。该项目被设计为 "一个庆祝活动，一个艺术和科学实验，以及对人类和外星人意味着什么的集体思考"，并与加泰罗尼亚空间研究所和METI合作开发。

 

2017年10月和2018年5月，在挪威特罗姆瑟的32米EISCAT天线上进行了发射，发射频率为≈930MHz，发射功率为1.5MW，比特率为62.5至500bps。音乐被编码为未压缩的PCM；由于带宽较低，每首曲子只有10s长，并以8 kHz、8 bit、单声道进行采样。该信息大约需要12.4个地球年才能到达目的地，使潜在的回复在2043年Sónar的50周年时及时到达。

 

SonarImage

自1994年第一届音乐节以来，由Sergio Caballero执导，Sonar的视觉形象是该音乐节身份的一个内在组成部分。
contentEn:
Sónar is an arts, design, and electronic and experimental music festival, founded in Barcelona in 1994 by Ricard Robles, Enric Palau, and Sergi Caballero. The festival has been divided into two parts since its inception: Sónar by Day and Sónar by Night, with a three-day congress dedicated to Creativity, Technology and Business running concurrently since 2013. As well as the flagship event in Barcelona, Sónar hosts events around the world, with annual festivals currently taking place in Bogota, Buenos Aires, Hong Kong, Reykjavik and Istanbul.

 

Artists that have performed at Sónar include Björk, Thom Yorke, Jean-Michel Jarre, Duran Duran, Grace Jones, Beastie Boys, De La Soul, Kraftwerk, Gorillaz, New Order, Skrillex, Diplo, M.I.A., Arca, Rosalía, Chic, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Aphex Twin, Richie Hawtin and Laurent Garnier.

 

Writing in 2017, the New York Times states that “Sónar has built itself into a European institution... It’s a festival of the experimental and the crowd-pleasing, the subtle and the unsubtle, scaled from quiet small-auditorium performances to seismic stadium dance music....[1]”

 

Birth and early years (1994–1996)

Sónar was founded in Barcelona in 1994 as the “Festival of Advanced Music and Multimedia Art”, by music journalist Ricard Robles and musicians and visual artists Enric Palau and Sergio Caballero. The first festival took place on 2, 3 and 4 June at the Centre de Cultura Contemporània de Barcelona (Sónar by Day) and the Apolo club (Sónar by Night), with performances by Holger Czukay, Mixmaster Morris, Laurent Garnier, Sven Väth, Atom Heart, and Trans Global Underground, among others. This first event, which included the Record Fair and Technology Fair - the forerunner of what is now known as Sonar+D - was attended by nearly 6,000 people and 40 representatives of the Spanish media.

 

Over the next two years, the festival expanded considerably: the number of accreditation holders doubled in 1995 and tripled in 1996, and the number of visitors rose from 6,000 to over 12,000 in 1995 and 18,000 in 1996. Sónar by Night relocated in its second year, moving to various areas in the Poble Espanyol, where it was based in 1995 and 1996. Some of performances and sessions during these years included Coldcut, Spring Heel Jack, Josh Wink, Autechre, Richie Hawtin, Ken Ishii, Slam, Jeff Mills, Scanner, Orbital, Fangoria, John Acquaviva, Kenny Larkin, and Biosphere.

 

Evolution and growth (1997–2000)

The year 1997 marked a turning point for the festival, as Sónar by Night moved to a new venue, the Mar Bella sports pavilion, tripling its capacity. With the late 1990s came considerable growth: from 18,000 visitors in 1996 to 28,000 in 1997, 38,000 in 1998, 43,000 in 1999 and over 53,000 in 2000. The festival's evolution can also be measured in the number of accredited media: in 1996 there were 72 Spanish and 15 international media, by 2000 the number had risen to 158 and 185, respectively.

 

Artists performing at Sónar by Day during these four years included Squarepusher, Fennesz, Bruce Gilbert, Patrick Pulsinger, Pan Sonic, Mouse On Mars, Suicide, Aviador Dro, DJ Spooky, Pole, DJ Zero, Goldfrapp, and Merzbow, Daft Punk, Kraftwerk, Kruder & Dorfmeister, Jimi Tenor, Laurent Garnier (under his real name or the alias DJ Jamon), Marc Almond, Deep Dish, Motorbass, Plastikman, Herbert, Death In Vegas, Fila Brazillia, Roger Sánchez, Coldcut, DJ Hell, Sólo Los Solo, Atari Teenage Riot, An Der Beat, Chicks On Speed, Super Collider, and Miss Kittin.

 

Sónar in the twenty-first century (2000–present)

In the early years of the new decade, Sónar continued to grow, first stabilizing at around 80,000 visitors each year and then growing further to 121,000 for its 20th anniversary in 2013. This attendance record was beaten again in 2017 (123,00) and at the 25th anniversary celebration in 2018 (126,000). In this period Sónar continued to exert an influence on critics and artists alike, thanks to its forward thinking programming and production. As the Financial Times reported in a 2006 review: "[The Scissor Sisters' Jake Shears] was not alone among artists in citing Sónar as a fundamental influence upon his career"[2]

 

The 2001 festival saw another change of venue for Sónar by Night to the larger venue of the Fira Gran Via area in L'Hospitalet de Llobregat. This new home meant that it was possible to offer large format concerts with a strong audiovisual component, attracting performances by artists such as bjork (2002), Kraftwerk (with a 3D show in 2013) and The Chemical Brothers (2005 and 2015).

 

The Sónar by Night Venue hosts several stages; the 15,000 capacity SonarClub, the open air SonarLab and SonarPub and SonarCar. In 2016 this stage received an upgrade, featuring a custom sound system and a new format featuring continuous 7hr sets by selected DJ's. The inaugural edition featured Laurent Garnier (who assisted in the format's development) and Four Tet.

 

Sónar by Day also consolidated its extensive range, which is based not only on music but also the exhibitions at SonarMàtica, the activities at SonarPro, the screenings at SonarCinema, and the installations at Sonarama. During these years, the festival also collaborated with various institutions, spaces, and centres such as the GREC festival, the Centre d’Arts Santa Mónica, the Mies Van Der Rohe Foundation, CosmoCaixa, and L'Auditori, the venue for concerts by the Barcelona Symphony and Catalonia National Orchestra with Ryuichi Sakamoto + Pan Sonic + Fennesz, Francesco Tristano + Murcof, Matthew Herbert Big Band, and DJ /rupture, among many others.

 

In 2013, Sónar by Day, moved out of its previous home in MACBA to a larger space in the Fira Montjuïc facilities at Plaza d'Espanya. The music program at Sónar by Day takes place over 5 stages: SonarHall, SonarDome (presented by Red Bull Music), the SonarComplex auditorium, SonarXS (dedicated to urban sounds from the global streets)  and the outdoor stage SonarVillage by Estrella Damm with its trademark artificial grass. In 2018, Sónar added an additional stage Sonar360º by Mediapro, dedicated to full dome experiences.

 

Notable artists performing in this period include M.I.A., De La Soul, Linton Kwesi Johnson, The Roots, Justice, Hot Chip,Janelle Monáe, Leila, Madlib, Prefuse 73, Ricardo Villalobos, Kode9, Plaid, The Sugarhill Gang, and Flying Lotus. Björk (2002), Beastie Boys (2007), LCD Soundsystem (2010), Chic (2006), Pet Shop Boys (2002), Masters At Work (2001), Grace Jones(2009), and The Chemical Brothers (2005 and 2015), Kraftwerk, Jurassic 5, Richie Hawtin, Skrillex, Paul Kalkbrenner, Major Lazer, Jamie Lidell, Diamond Version, Chromatics, Diplo, Baauer, Nicolas Jaar, Liars, Lindstrøm & Todd Terje, Adrian Sherwood & Pinch, Seth Troxler, Gold Panda. Autechre, FKA Twigs, A$AP Rocky Jean-Michel Jarre, New Order, and Anhoni.

 

In 2019, Sónar shifted the date of its Barcelona edition from June to July and increased its focus on acts from the Latin, urban, trap and reggaeton music genres.[3]

 

Sónar and Barcelona

In 2004, Sónar contributed 47 million euros to Catalonia's GDP (according to a study performed by Deloitte) A follow-up 360º study commissioned by Sónar in 2015 updated this figure to 126 million euros; a 226% increase over the decade, with a net value to the city of 559.7 Euros per attendee.

 

The impact on hotel occupancy in the city is also considerable. Occupancy rate in 2011 was 83.65%, and in 2012 it was 83.11%. These figures increase to 100% for officially approved tourist apartments.

 

In addition to the above, Sónar also leads to the proliferation and organisation of other events, presentations and showcases that take place in Barcelona outside the scope of the festival itself, which in turn also attract very large audiences of between 50 and 70 thousand visitors, in addition to the 126,000 visitors attending the official event.[4]

 

Sónar around the world

Since making its first international foray to London in 2002, Sónar has expanded its presence globally, having hosted eponymous events in 65 cities worldwide and across 4 continents. All Sónar events reflect the wider mission of creating a dialogue between the local and international scene in each territory, and feature a strong creative technological component.

 

To date, these locations include Chicago, Buenos Aires, São Paulo, Hamburg, Bogota, New York, Seoul, Rome, Cape Town, Copenhagen, Tokyo and Hong Kong. Sónar+D has also expanded its international program in recent years, forming part of the program in São Paulo (2015) Santiago de Chile (2015), Buenos Aires (2015), Reykjavik (2015), Bogota (2015, 2016, 2017, 2018), Hong Kong (2017) and Istanbul (2017).

 

As of 2018, Sónar hosts yearly events in 6 cities, with a combined yearly attendance of 30,000.

 

Sónar Reykjavik

Sónar Reykjavik takes place across four stages in the HARPA concert hall. Notable acts to have played include Skrillex, Underworld, Danny Brown, Fatboy Slim, Gus Gus, Kiasmos and Paul Kalkbrenner.

 

"A must for anyone wanting to combine the experience of some breathtaking natural beauty alongside a programme of world-leading electronic music"[5]

"The festival is ‘an experiment in how music can reach those who truly seek it’"[6]

 

Sónar Istanbul

The inaugural edition of Sónar Istanbul took place in 2017 at the ZorluPSM auditorium. To date, the festival has featured performances by artists including, Nina Kraviz, Black Coffee, Fatboy Slim and Jon Hopkins.

 

Sónar Hong Kong

In 2017, Sónar added Hong Kong to its international festivals. Taking place at Hong Kong Science Park the event has featured performances from DJ Shadow, Laurent Garnier, The Black Madonna and Squarepusher among others.

 

"In total, the festival featured more than 40 international, regional and local DJs and live acts – including 11 making their HK debut – as Sónar once again confirmed its reputation as the world's best electronic music festival.[7]

 

Sónar Bogota and Sónar Buenos Aires.

Sónar's Latin American dates take place in late November annually, at Multiparque (Sónar Bogotá) and Technopolis Argentina (Sónar Buenos Aires). Notable artists to have performed include Sigur Rós, Nina Kraviz, Dubfire, Pantha du Prince, Moderat and more.

 

Sónar is part of We are Europe

Since December 2015, Sónar is part of We are Europe, a cooperation project co-founded by the Creative Europe programme of the European Union, led by the French organization Arty Farty (Nuits sonores Festival) and gathering 8 major European events joining forces in order to promote, create and produce innovative cultural practices, defined by creative diversity and exchanges.

 

Sónar +D

In its inaugural edition in 1994, Sónar organized a fair for professionals with a dual dimension: a record and publishing fair (record labels, distributors, publications, publishers, promoters) and a technology fair (hardware and software brands, musical equipment companies). This format would undergo several incarnations over the years, gradually evolving away from the trade fair format and expanding to include art installations, film screenings, talks and conferences. Coinciding with the move of Sónar by Day to Fira Montjuic in 2013, this section of the festival program was re-imagined as Sónar+D.

 

Oriented as a 3-day congress of Creativity, Technology and Business running concurrently to Sónar by Day, (SonaR+D = Sónar+D). The congress includes installations, talks, exhibitions and displays of new technologies with creative applications. Since 2017, a Networking Day has been added to the program. Starting one day before the start of the festival this event is oriented towards b2b activities, and only accessible to Delegate pass holders.

 

During the 3 days of Sónar by Day, 80% of the activities at Sónar+D are open to general admission ticket holders, encouraging cross-pollination between, artists, makers and the creatively curious.

 

Sónar +D also feeds from and into the wider festival program, with tech-shows featured across all the festival stages, and prominent artists invited to give talks and workshops. Recent editions have featured artists and thinkers such as Brian Eno, Björk, Jean-Michel Jarre, Richie Hawtin, Kode 9, Holly Herndon,[8] Alva Noto and Ryuichi Sakamoto.

 

As of 2018, companies and institutions  that have actively participated in Sónar+D  include BBC R+D, Spotify, Google Arts and Culture, Universal Music Group, Sony Music, PS4, HP, Me by Melia, Mediapro, Native Instruments, MIT Media Lab, Roland Instruments and Pioneer DJ, among others.

 

Sónar+D Hong Kong, takes place concurrently to the annual Sónar Hong Kong event at Hong Kong Science Park.  

 

Sónar Calling GJ273b

To commemorate Sónar's 25th anniversary in 2018, the festival embarked on an experiment to send 33 pieces of music to Luyten b, a potentially habitable exo-planet located 12.4 light years from Earth. Artists close to the festival who submitted specially created pieces of music include Jean-Michel Jarre, Autechre, Squarepusher, Nina Kraviz, The Black Madonna, Matmos, Laurent Garnier and Olafur Arnalds. The project was devised as "A celebration, an artistic and scientific experiment and a collective rumination on what it means to be human, and alien",[9] and developed in collaboration with the Catalonia Institute of Space Studies and METI.

 

The transmissions took place in October 2017 and May 2018 from the 32 m EISCAT antenna in Tromsø, Norway operating at ≈930 MHz with 1.5 MW transmitting power and bit rates of 62.5 to 500 bps. The music was encoded as uncompressed PCM; due to the low bandwidth each piece was only 10 s long and sampled with 8 kHz, 8 bit, mono.[10] The message will take approximately 12.4 Earth years to arrive at its destination, making a potential reply arrive in time for Sónar's 50th anniversary in 2043.

 

SonarImage

Directed by Sergio Caballero since the first festival in 1994, Sónar's visual image is an intrinsic part of the festival's identity.
